titles.title: A bill to require the coloring of certain gasolines in order to enable the public to better identify the octane of gasoline purchased.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on Energy and Commerce.
Referred to Subcommittee on Energy and Power.

bill.summary: 10/12/1988--Introduced. Requires the Secretary of Commerce to promulgate regulations requiring refiners to implement a procedure for the coloring of unleaded gasoline to enable a retail purchaser to identify its octane.
